meanings.definition: The quality or state of being nice.
meanings.sent1: Her nicenesses towards others always brightened their day.
meanings.sent2: The nicenesses of the neighborhood made it a great place to live.
meanings.sent3: The nicenesses of the puppy were evident in its wagging tail.
meanings.sent4: The garden was filled with the nicenesses of blooming flowers.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's nicenesses were appreciated by all the students.

meanings.sent1: Random nicenesses from strangers can make a big difference.
meanings.sent2: She showed her nicenesses by helping the elderly lady cross the street.
meanings.sent3: The cat's nicenesses included bringing gifts of mice to its owner.
meanings.sent4: The nicenesses of the volunteers warmed the hearts of those in need.
meanings.sent5: His nicenesses extended to everyone he met, making him well-loved.

meanings.sent1: The nicenesses of the weather made the picnic enjoyable.
meanings.sent2: The nicenesses of the music filled the room with joy.
meanings.sent3: The cake's nicenesses were evident in its delicious aroma.
meanings.sent4: The nicenesses of the park drew people in for a relaxing afternoon.
meanings.sent5: The nicenesses of the conversation made the evening memorable.
